TopicTitle: The Tradition Continues... I killed Jeb again!

Articles.Content:
Anyone else watch poor Jeb smash into a million pieces?

His death was the result of a poorly-timed time-warp which smashed his little pod through Kerbin.
Crashed the Ares 4A while on a joyride...
Forgot about his return in a Near Munar return mission, was flying a ship piloted by Bob when his smashed into Kerban.... Poor Jeb......

Jeb is way too busy being awesome and doing all the science to die in my latest save. Seems like just having him in the pilot seat gives a bonus to being able to pull off obscenely risky things. To wit: last mission he got back to Kerbin with barely 2 litres of fuel left in his 400-litre ship.
Well he died several times today (for me), testing out the RAPIER.

I've never killed Jeb in my save files.

The rest of the Kerbals, on the other hand...

Spiralling out of control riding a Solid Rocket Booster. I think it's the way he would've wanted to go. Screaming across the ocean on something he couldn't control. Looked into his helmet and he was smiling the whole time. It's really become tradition that I make one save file where I sacrifice the main three on launch day in order to guarantee safe flights.

Good Ole Jeb is fearless..

No matter how spinning out of control your space ship is as its blowing up and breaking apart. The others are all terrified, and Jebs having ablast!!

Spiralling out of control riding a Solid Rocket Booster. I think it's the way he would've wanted to go. Screaming across the ocean on something he couldn't control.

I'm pretty sure this is what is put on Jeb's tombstone.
I turn on permadeath in my saves and send him on a one-way spaceplane ride into the ocean so I never have to see him in the crew list again.

I turn on permadeath in my saves and send him on a one-way spaceplane ride into the ocean so I never have to see him in the crew list again.

As do I (minus the kerbocide). I don't know why, I find that the white suited kerbals just have so much more personality and I can attribute much more to them. I might resurrect him to act as a sort of teacher to the new recruits.
